With remote learning increasingly likely, districts try to reach the most vulnerable studentsDirected by state education officials to prioritize these students for in-person instruction — children with disabilities, those still learning English, and others disproportionately affected by the school shutdown in the spring — many districts have drafted plans that carve out classroom time for those groups, and for their youngest learners, first.

As US hits 5 million coronavirus cases, Europe is alarmed and astonished by American response to outbreakMuch of the incredulity in Europe stems from the fact that America had the benefit of time, European experience, and medical know-how to treat the virus. Yet, more than four months into the outbreak, the United States hit 5 million confirmed infections, easily the highest in the world.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.

As US hits 5 million coronavirus cases, Europe is alarmed and astonished by American response to outbreakMuch of the incredulity in Europe stems from the fact that America had the benefit of time, European experience, and medical know-how to treat the virus. Yet, more than four months into the outbreak, the United States hit 5 million confirmed infections, easily the highest in the world.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.

With remote learning increasingly likely, districts try to reach the most vulnerable studentsBy Friday, district officials must tell the state which approach they will take: remote-only, in-person school, or some combination. With this in mind, many schools have carved out plans that prioritize at-risk students — children with disabilities, those still learning English, and others disproportionately affected by the school shutdown in the spring.

White House asked South Dakota governor about adding Trump to Mount Rushmore; she presented him with a replicaLast year, a White House aide reached out to South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem's office about the process to add additional presidents to Mount Rushmore. When President Trump visited the monument for a fireworks-filled July Fourth extravaganza this summer, Noem greeted him with a 4-foot replica of Mount Rushmore that included a fifth presidential likeness: his.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.

White House asked South Dakota governor about adding Trump to Mount Rushmore; she presented him with a replicaLast year, a White House aide reached out to South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem's office about the process to add additional presidents to Mount Rushmore. When President Trump visited the monument for a fireworks-filled July Fourth extravaganza this summer, Noem greeted him with a 4-foot replica of Mount Rushmore that included a fifth presidential likeness: his.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.

When President Trump visited the monument for a fireworks-filled July Fourth extravaganza this summer, Noem greeted him with a 4-foot replica of Mount Rushmore that included a fifth presidential likeness: his.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.

White House asked S.D. governor about adding a president to Mount Rushmore; she gave Trump a replica with him on itLast year, a White House aide reached out to South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem's office about the process to add additional presidents to Mount Rushmore. When President Trump visited the monument for a fireworks-filled July Fourth extravaganza this summer, Noem greeted him with a 4-foot replica of Mount Rushmore that included a fifth presidential likeness: his.

The Great DivideFamilies with means leave public schools for private schools or ‘learning pods,’ raising concerns about worsening educational inequality While experts say the shift is predictable, it could also have dire consequences in the near and long-terms, as these families — who are much more likely to be middle or upper-income — take with them vital funding and political advocacy for the public schools.
